resources.string: This recipe is a prime example of low-temperature roasting, and you will have to start cooking at least 5 hours before you want to eat. It\'s a great showcase for dry-aged meat, if you can get hold of some, but it\'ll suit any good-quality rib of beef. I cook the meat to 55C, which will make it medium-rare, but if you prefer it rarer or more done, refer to the photograph below for the appropriate temperature. The bone marrow gives the sauce a rich, unctuous character, but if you can\'t obtain bone marrow, you can make the sauce without it.
